_meta.instructions: Add your responses to the jarvis_responses array for each task. Each response needs: content (your message). The import will create comments from Jarvis.

jarvis_responses.content: ğŸ“ This is a quick win! Shift managers often need to communicate special instructions (dress code, training, events). I can implement this with a simple notes field on shifts + optional notification to assigned employees. Should be straightforward - just DB column + UI field. Want me to start this in Sprint 2? - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ“Š Great for recruitment analytics! We'd need: 1) stage_history table to log transitions with timestamps, 2) Calculate average time per stage, 3) Dashboard widget showing bottlenecks. This helps identify slow stages (e.g., 'Candidates stuck in Interview for 10+ days'). Pairs nicely with Pipeline Filters. - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ¤ Nice HR feature for manager-employee relationships! Key components: 1) Meeting scheduler with recurring option, 2) Private notes (manager-only), 3) Shared notes (both see), 4) Action items with due dates, 5) History timeline. Consider: Should integrate with calendar? Google Calendar sync would be ğŸ”¥ - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

âš ï¸ Important for attendance accountability! Logic: If shift_end_time passed + no check-in = No-Show. Features needed: 1) Auto-flag after shift ends, 2) Manager notification (Telegram bot alert?), 3) No-show counter per employee, 4) Grace period setting. Could trigger after X minutes past shift start. Integrates with existing attendance system. - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ’¬ Employee voice is crucial! Scope: 1) Survey builder (questions, rating scales, text), 2) Anonymous mode (no user tracking), 3) Schedule recurring (weekly pulse?), 4) Results dashboard with trends, 5) eNPS calculation. Could start simple: 'How are you feeling this week?' 1-5 scale + optional comment. Telegram bot could send reminders! - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ¯ Ready to implement! Filter options: 1) Stage (Applied, Screening, Interview, Offer, Hired, Rejected), 2) Source (Job board, Referral, Direct, etc), 3) Date range (applied_at), 4) Recruiter/Assigned to. UI: Filter bar above pipeline with dropdowns + clear filters button. Should persist filters in URL for sharing. Want me to start? - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ“ˆ This pairs perfectly with Employee Directory! Timeline events: Hired, Position change, Salary adjustment, Branch transfer, Achievement/Award, Training completed, Performance review. Could show on employee profile as a visual timeline. We already track some of this in audit logs - just need to surface it nicely! - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ“… This is in Sprint 2 - let's prioritize! Options: 1) Week view (columns = days, rows = branches), 2) Month view (calendar grid), 3) Day view (detailed hourly). Color coding: by branch or by employee status (assigned/unassigned). Drag-drop to reassign shifts would be ğŸ”¥. Which view should we start with? - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

âœ… Let's discuss! Implementation plan: 1) Add checkboxes to candidate cards, 2) 'Select All' in header, 3) Floating action bar appears when 1+ selected, 4) Actions: Move to Stage, Reject (with reason template), Assign Recruiter, Send Email. For rejection - should we require a reason? Also, should we add email templates for bulk reject? Ready to build when you give the green light! ğŸš€ - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

ğŸ¢ Big feature! Two parts: 1) Directory - searchable list with filters (branch, department, position). Card view with photo, name, role, contact. 2) Org Chart - hierarchical tree visualization. Challenge: We need manager_id on employees to build hierarchy. Do we have that field? If not, I can add it. Also: should Org Chart be interactive (click to drill down)? - Jarvis ğŸ¤–

jarvis_summary: ğŸ¤– Sprint 1 was a HUGE success - 100% completion with 8 tasks done! Sprint 2 is underway with goal 'Complete HR module and Accounting'. You have 3 tasks in To Do (Visual Shift Calendar, Employee Timeline, Employee Directory), 7 in Backlog. I've added my thoughts on each backlog item. Priority focus for Sprint 2: Visual Shift Calendar (already assigned) + Bulk Actions for Candidates (you wanted to discuss). The recruitment features (Pipeline Filters, Bulk Actions) are P0 and should probably be tackled soon!
